events.1891: Gandhiji sailed for India and reached in July.
events.1894: Busushottam Vishwanath Bapat, internationally famed Pali language expert, translator and editor, was born.
events.1897: Possibly the most severe quake in history strikes Assam, shock waves felt over an area size of Europe (negligible death toll).
events.1952: J&K Assembly decided to terminate hereditary monarchy.
events.1960: 783 Sikhs are arrested while demonstrating for an independent Sikh state in New Delhi.
events.1970: Gopinath Kaviraj, Padmavibhushan awardee and critic, passed away.
events.1972: D. G. Tendulkar, historian who had written the autobiography of Mahatma Gandhi, died.
events.1975: Drugaprasad Dhar, former deputy president of Planning Commission, died.
events.1976: Mahamahopadhyaya Pandit Gopinath Kaviraj, editor and master, died at Varanasi.
events.1990: Indian National Satellite (INSAT-1D) launched. This is an operational multi-purpose communication and meteorology satellite. It is still in service. It was launched by US Delta launch vehicle, Kennedy Space Centre in Florida, USA.
events.1996: India's new prime minister H. D. Deve Gowda wins vote of confidence in the Lok Sabha and will rule as head of the United Front Coalition.
events.1997: Mihir Sen, long distance swimmer, died.
events.1999: Jalagam Vengal Rao, former Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh, died in Hyderabad.
events.2000: The Government appointed S. K. Mahajan of  Delhi High Court as the chairman of the one-man tribunal to adjudicate whether or not there was sufficient cause for declaring LTTE as unlawful.
